meanings.definition: To make sweet or sweeter in taste
meanings.sent1: Adding a spoonful of sugar can dulcify the bitter coffee.
meanings.sent2: The chef used honey to dulcify the tangy sauce.
meanings.sent3: She tried to dulcify the spicy curry with a touch of cream.
meanings.sent4: His kind words dulcified her heart like a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song dulcified the listener's soul.

meanings.sent1: A gentle lullaby can dulcify a crying baby.
meanings.sent2: The apology helped dulcify the hurt feelings.
meanings.sent3: His calm demeanor dulcified the tense situation.
meanings.sent4: The soft candlelight dulcified the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The cool breeze dulcified the sweltering heat of the day.

meanings.definition: To make more agreeable or pleasant
meanings.sent1: Adding some flowers can dulcify the room's decor.
meanings.sent2: Her smile never failed to dulcify his mood.
meanings.sent3: A good joke can dulcify a serious conversation.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery dulcified the long journey.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of children dulcified the park with joy.
